sentences.en: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.cn: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.en: He is to retire on his sixtieth birthday.
sentences.cn: 他准备在60岁生日那天退休。

sentences.en: He says he is going to retire; but quaere , is it true?
sentences.cn: 他说他将退休, 果真 吗 ?

sentences.en: He was forced to retire because of ill health.
sentences.cn: 由于健康问题他不得不退休。

sentences.en: I retired to my room to think.
sentences.cn: 我躲进自己的房间去思考。

sentences.en: I'm afraid I have quite a disinclination to retire on a pension.
sentences.cn: 恐怕我很不愿意领养老金退休.

sentences.en: It would be nice to be able to afford to retire earlier.
sentences.cn: 无后顾之忧而能提早退休当是件幸事。

sentences.en: Once people retire they automatically cease to be union members.
sentences.cn: 人们一旦退休就自动不再是工会会员.

sentences.en: Replete, guests can then retire to the modern conservatory for coffee.
sentences.cn: 吃饱喝足后，宾客们可以到现代化的暖房里享受一杯咖啡。

sentences.en: She is to retire as from 1 October.
She was forced to retire early from teaching because of ill health.
sentences.cn: 她由于身体不好而被迫早早地从教学岗位上退休。

sentences.en: The jury will retire to consider its verdict today.
sentences.cn: 陪审团今天将退庭商议裁决结果。

sentences.en: The magazine suggested incorrectly that he was planning to retire.
sentences.cn: 该杂志错误地暗示他正打算退休。

sentences.en: The officer ordered the troop to retire from the action.
sentences.cn: 军官下令将部队撤出战斗.

sentences.en: The old man held onto his job stubbornly and would not retire.
sentences.cn: 那老人倔强地不肯脱离工作岗位,不愿意退休.

sentences.en: When I retire, I shall make my home in the country.
sentences.cn: 退休后我将在乡间安家.

sentences.en: Will she yield to growing pressure for her to retire?
sentences.cn: 面对要求其隐退的压力越来越大，她会屈服吗？

words.tran_cn: 退休的；不善社交的；过隐居生活的

phrases.tran_cn: 退隐，沉默；(沉湎于自己的思想而)离群索居

trans.tran_cn: 退休，退出，离开，退庭，睡觉，出局，撤退
trans.tran_en: when a  jury  in a law court retires, they go away to consider whether someone is guilty or not
to go away to a quiet place
